result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cole R Glesner in court.  Attorney Erika L Bierma in court for Cole R Glesner.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Samuel Berg. Called @ 1:41 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for arraignment and to address DE motion to file additional motions. State is not objecting to the motion - granted. Record by Atty. Bierma who enters not guilty plea on behalf of defendant. Discussion as to scheduling. Court will allow defendant to appear by phone for next hearing. Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Motion for Leave to File Additional Motions

records.addlTxt:
2:04 PM (64-06) Defendant Cole R Glesner in court.  Attorney Erika L Bierma in court for Cole R Glesner.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin ADA Berg in court. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 

State is requesting an Arraignment date.

Attorney Bierma is requesting defendant be able to appear via phone at next hearing, in college 3 hours away.
No objection by the State.
Court will allow defendant to appear via phone for Arraignment Hearing.

Adj. 2:08PM
Arraignment scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH C.I.'S IN COMPLAINT IF KNOWN TO DEFENDANT. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cole R Glesner in court.  Attorney Erika L Bierma in court for Cole R Glesner. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Preliminary hearing requested within time period. Signature bond set. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Cole R Glesner
Current: 210 E. Lisbon Rd, Oconomowoc, WI 53066 United States  (Effective: 07-14-2022)
Prior: 2613 Oakcrest Dr, Waukesha, WI 53188

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cole R Glesner not in court.  Letter to re-schedule in file. Minutes filed.
Initial appearance scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
